intro: Crocus veneris, commonly known as the sacred crocus, is a species of flowering plant in the Iridaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. The plant produces showy, cup-shaped flowers in shades of yellow, white, and orange, typically blooming in late autumn or early winter. Its bulbs are adapted for cold climates and can remain dormant during harsh weather. The plant is also valued for its ornamental beauty and historical significance in various cultures.
